member.name: T:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary
member.summary: Summary description for DefinitionQueryLibrary.

member.name: T:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.IXPathQueryInterface
member.summary: The IXPathQueryInterface provides functions that allow an user to query definition files by using XPath Queries. The purpose of the interface is to provide users with a set of functions that allow advanced custom queries.

member.name: T:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.ISimpleQueryInterface
member.summary: The ISimpleQueryInterface provides functions that allow an user to query definition files in a commando way. Each function covers a specific query. The purpose of the interface is to provide users with a set of simple functions that can easy be used to retrieve specific information from Xml Definition files.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.dqFileManager
member.summary: For managing Xml Definition files.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.dqQueryManager
member.summary: For managing pre-compiled XPath Expression queries.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.sopClassUID
member.summary: For the SOP Class UID used in queries.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.systemName
member.summary: For the System Name used in queries.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.queryDocument
member.summary: For the Xml Definition file that is used in the query.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.queryNavigator
member.summary: For the navigator used to execute the query against the queryDocument

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.queryExpression
member.summary: For a cloned copy of the pre-compiled expression used in the Query.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.queryNodeIterator
member.summary: For iterating trough the result of the query.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the DefinitionQueryLibrary class.

example.code:
' Example: Create a new DefinitionQueryLibrary.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary()

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.LoadFile(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the Xml Definition file to make it available for executing XPath queries or Simple Query Functions.
member.param: Full path to the Xml Definition File.

example.code:
' Example: Load a Xml Definition File.
Dim dqLibrary AS DefinitionQueryLibrary dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary()
dqLibrary.LoadFile(@"C:\example.xml")

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetLoadedFiles
member.summary: Provides a list of all the Xml Definition files that are currently loaded.
member.returns: An Array of strings containing the full path of all Xml Definition files.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.Query(System.String)
member.summary: Execute a XPath Query against the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set as default.
member.param: XPath compatible query.

example.code:
' Example: Execute a raw XPath Query on the default ' SOP Class and System Name.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim myNodeIterator As XPathNodeIterator Dim myExpression As string Dim version As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary()
' Set the default SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetDefaultSOPClassUID("1.2.3.4.55.145.9.2.1") dqLibrary.SetDefaultSystemName("DICOM")
' Create an expression that queries for the System Version. myExpression = "/System/@Version"
myNodeIterator = dqLibrary.Query(myExpression)
' Move to the result. myNodeIterator.MoveNext() myNodeIterator.Current.MoveToFirstAttribute()
' Show the result. Console.WriteLine(myNodeIterator.Current.Value)

member.returns: A XPathNodeIterator with the query results.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the XPath query is invalid or the Xml Definition file is not loaded.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.Query(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a XPath Query against the Xml Definition file with the provided filename.
member.param: XPath compatible query.
Full path to the Xml Definition file. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Execute a raw XPath Query on the provided Xml ' Definition file.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim myNodeIterator As XPathNodeIterator Dim myExpression As string Dim version As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary()
' Create an expression that queries for the System Version. myExpression = "/System/@Version"
myNodeIterator = dqLibrary.Query(myExpression, @"C:\example.xml")
' Move to the result. myNodeIterator.MoveNext() myNodeIterator.Current.MoveToFirstAttribute()
' Show the result. Console.WriteLine(myNodeIterator.Current.Value)

member.returns: A XPathNodeIterator with the query results.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the XPath query is invalid or the Xml Definition file is not loaded.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.Query(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a XPath Query against the Xml Definition file with the provided SOP Class UID and System Name.
member.param: XPath compatible query.
SOP Class UID of the Xml Definition file to run the query on. See also the example code.
System Name of the Xml Definition file to run the query on. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Execute a raw XPath Query on the Xml Definition ' file with the given SOP Class UID and System Name.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim myNodeIterator As XPathNodeIterator Dim myExpression As string Dim version As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary()
' Create an expression that queries for the System Version. myExpression = "/System/@Version"
myNodeIterator = dqLibrary.Query(myExpression, "1.2.545.877.144.9.2.1", "Dicom")
' Move to the result. myNodeIterator.MoveNext() myNodeIterator.Current.MoveToFirstAttribute()
' Show the result. Console.WriteLine(myNodeIterator.Current.Value)

member.returns: A XPathNodeIterator with the query results.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the XPath query is invalid or the Xml Definition file is not loaded.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetSOPClassUID
member.summary: Gets the SOP Class UID that is used in a query functions.
member.returns: A string containing the SOP Class UID.

example.code:
' Example: Get the SOP Class UID. Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim myUID As string
dqLibrary - new DefinitionQueryLibrary() myUID = dqLibrary.GetSOPClassUID()
Console.WriteLine("The SOP Class UID is: " + myUID)

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.SetSOPClassUID(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the SOP Class UID that is used in query functions.
member.param: SOP Class UID. See also the code example.

example.code:
' Example: Set the SOP Class UID. Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLirbary() dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.3.8.14.65.88.1.2")

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetSystemName
member.summary: Gets the System Name that is used in query functions.
member.returns: A string containing the System Name.

example.code:
' Example: Get the System Name. Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim mySystemName As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary() mySystemName = dqLibrary.GetSystemName()
Console.WriteLine("The System Name is: " + myUID)

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.SetSystemName(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the System Name that is used in query functions.
member.param: System Name. See also the code example.

example.code:
' Example: Set the System Name. Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLirbary() dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetSystemVersion
member.summary: Get the System Version from the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.

example.code:
' Example: Get the System Version from the Xml Definition ' file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim systemVersion As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
systemVersion = dqLibrary.GetSystemVersion()
if (systemVersion <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The System Version = " + systemVersion) end if

member.returns: A string containing the System Version. If for some reason no System Version was found, null will be returned.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetApplicationName
member.summary: Get the Application Name from the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Application Name from the Xml Definition ' file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim applicationName As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
applicationName = dqLibrary.GetApplicationName()
if (applicationName <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Application Name = " + applicationName) end if

member.returns: A string containing the Application Name. If for some reason no Application Name was found, null will be returned.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAllDimseCommands
member.summary: Get all Dimse Commands for the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.

example.code:
' Example: Get all Dimse Commands from the Xml Definition ' file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim dimseCommands As StringCollection Dim dimseCommand As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
dimseCommands = dqLibrary.GetAllDimseCommands()
// Show all the results by iterating trough the array. For Each dimseCommand in dimseCommands Console.WriteLine("The Dimse Command = " + dimseCommand) Next dimseCommand

member.returns: A StringCollection containing all the Dimse Commands as string.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAllModules
member.summary: Get all Modules for the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.

example.code:
' Example: Get all Modules from the Xml Definition file ' with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim modules As StringCollection Dim module As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
modules = dqLibrary.GetAllModules()
' Show all the results by iterating trough the array. For Each module in modules Console.WriteLine("The Module = " + module) Next module

member.returns: A StringCollection containing all the Modules as string.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAllModules(System.String)
member.summary: Get all Modules for the specific Dimse Command for the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
member.param: The Dimse Command. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Get all Modules for the specific Dimse Command ' from the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and ' System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim modules As StringCollection Dim module As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
modules = dqLibrary.GetAllModules("C-STORE-RQ")
// Show all the results by iterating trough the array. For Each module in modules Console.WriteLine("The C-STORE-RQ Dimse Command has the Module = " + module) Next module

member.returns: A StringCollection containing all the Modules of the Dimse Command as string.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetModuleUsage(System.String)
member.summary: Get the Usage information for the Module specified in ModuleName from the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
member.param: The Module Name to get the Usage for. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Module Usage for the specific Module ' from the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and ' System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim usage As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
usage = dqLibrary.GetModuleUsage("Patient Module")
// Show the result. if (usage <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Usage for the Patient Module = " + usage) end if

member.returns: A string containing the module usage. If the Module ModuleName was not found null will be returned for Module Usage.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAllAttributes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get all Attributes for the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. If the Subitems is set to True also subitems will be included.
member.param: Determines whether subitems are also included. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Get all Attributes from the Xml Definition file ' with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. Not ' including subitems.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributes As StringCollection Dim attribute As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
attributes = dqLibrary.GetAllAttributes(false)
// Show all the results by iterating trough the array. For Each attribute in attributes Console.WriteLine("The Attribute = " + attribute) Next attribute

member.returns: A StringCollection containing all the Attributes as string. The format of the string will be like 0x012345678.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAllAttributesInDimseCommand(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get all Attributes for the specific Dimse Command for the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. This also includes attributes that are nested in sequences. If the Subitems is set to True also subitems will be included.
member.param: The Dimse Command containing the Attributes. See also the example code.
Determines whether subitems are also included. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Get all Attributes for the specific Dimse ' Command from the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class ' UID and System Name that are set. Not including subitems.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributes As StringCollection Dim attribute As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
attributes = dqLibrary.GetAllAttributesInDimseCommand("C-STORE-RQ", false)
// Show all the results by iterating trough the array. For Each attribute in attributes Console.WriteLine("The Attribute = " + attribute) Next attribute

member.returns: A StringCollection containing all the Attributes as string. The format of the string will be like 0x012345678.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAllAttributesInModule(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get all Attributes for the specific Module for the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. This also includes attributes that are nested in sequences. If the Subitems is set to True also subitems will be included.
member.param: The Module containing the Attributes. See also the example code.
Determines whether subitems are also included. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Get all Attributes for the specific Module from ' the Xml Definition file with the SOP Class UID and System ' Name that are set. Not including subitems.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributes As StringCollection Dim attribute As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
attributes = dqLibrary.GetAllAttributesInModule("Patient Module", false)
// Show all the results by iterating trough the array. For Each attribute in attributes Console.WriteLine("The Attribute = " + attribute) Next attribute

member.returns: A StringCollection containing all the Attributes as string. The format of the string will be like 0x012345678.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAllAttributesInAttribute(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Attributes in the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes. If the Subitems is set to True also subitems will be included.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the Enumerated Values for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.
Determines whether subitems are also included. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attributes in the given Attribute ' using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributes As StringCollection Dim attribute As String
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute, look also inside other Attributes (Recursive) ' and return all sub Attributes. attributes = dqLibrary.GetAllAttributesinAttribute("0x00101010", true, true)
' Show the result. For Each attribute in attributes Console.WriteLine("The Attribute 0x00101010 contains Attribute = " + attribute) Next attribute
' Attribute path, don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive) ' but return all sub Attributes. attributes = dqLibrary.GetAllAttributesinAttribute("0x00101010/0x20205555", false, true)
' Show the result. For Each attribute in attributes Console.WriteLine("The Attribute 0x20205555 contains Attribute = " + attribute) Next attribute

member.returns: Returns a StringCollection containing the Attributes as String.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeTree
member.summary: Get a list of all the Attributes as tree. See also the example code.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute tree.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributes As StringCollection Dim attribute As String
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
attributes = dqLibrary.GetAttributeTree()
' Show the result. For Each attribute in attributes Console.WriteLine(attribute) Next attribute
' This will output: ' ' 0x01234567 ' 0x01234567/0x15465478 ' 0x01234567/0x25478963 ' 0x01234567/0x65487632 ' 0x01234567/0x65487632/0x12547885 ' 0x01234567/0x65487632/0x12547896

member.returns: Returns a StringCollection containing the Attribute tree.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeType(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Type for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the Type for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute Type for the given Attribute ' using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributeType As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeType = dqLibrary.GetAttributeType("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. if (attributeType <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Type for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + attributeType) end if
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeType = dqLibrary.GetAttributeType("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributeType <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Type for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeType) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the Type. If the Attribute is not found null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeVM(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the VM for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the VM for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute VM for the given Attribute ' using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributeVM As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeVM = dqLibrary.GetAttributeVM("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. if (attributeVM <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute VM for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + attributeVM) end if
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeVM = dqLibrary.GetAttributeVM("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributeVM <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute VM for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeVM) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the VM. If the Attribute is not found null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeVR(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the VR for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the VR for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute VR for the given Attribute ' using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributeVR As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeVR = dqLibrary.GetAttributeVR("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. if (attributeVR <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute VR for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + attributeVR) end if
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeVR = dqLibrary.GetAttributeVR("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributeVR <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute VR for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeVR) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the VR. If the Attribute is not found null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeCondition(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Condition for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the Condition for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute Condition for the given ' Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that ' are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributeCondition As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeCondition = dqLibrary.GetAttributeCondition("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. if (attributeCondition <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Condition for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + attributeCondition) end if
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeCondition = dqLibrary.GetAttributeCondition("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributeCondition <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Condition for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeCondition) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the Condition. If the Attribute is not found or there is no Condition for the Attribute null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeComment(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Comment for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the COmment for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute Comment for the given ' Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that ' are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributeComment As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeComment = dqLibrary.GetAttributeComment("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. if (attributeComment <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Comment for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + attributeComment) end if
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeComment = dqLibrary.GetAttributeComment("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributeComment <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Comment for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeComment) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the Comment. If the Attribute is not found or there is no Comment for the Attribute null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Name for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the Name for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute Name for the given ' Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that ' are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributeName As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeName = dqLibrary.GetAttributeName("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. if (attributeName <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Name for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + attributeName) end if
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeName = dqLibrary.GetAttributeName("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributeName <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Name for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeName) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the Name. If the Attribute is not found null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeSource(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Source for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the Source for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute Source for the given ' Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that ' are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributeSource As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeSource = dqLibrary.GetAttributeSource("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. if (attributeSource <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Source for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + attributeSource) end if
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributeSource = dqLibrary.GetAttributeSource("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributeSource <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Source for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeSource) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the Source. If the Attribute is not found or there is no Source for the Attribute null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributePresenceOfValue(System.String,System.Boolean)

example.code:

Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim attributePresenceOfValue As string
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")

' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). attributePresenceOfValue = dqLibrary.GetAttributePresenceOfValue("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. if (attributePresenceOfValue <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Presence Of Value for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributePresenceOfValue) end if

member.returns: Returns a String containing the Presence Of Value. If the Attribute is not found or there is no Presence Of Value for the Attribute null wil be returned.
member.remarks: The function will always use the first matching Attribute.

' Show the result. if (attributeMatchingKey <> nothing) then Console.WriteLine("The Attribute Matching Key for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + attributeMatchingKey) end if

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeValues(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Values (Defined and Enumerated) for the Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that are set. With Recursive it is also possible to look inside other Attributes.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the Values (Defined and Enumerated) for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.
If true the Attribute or Attribute path will also be searched inside other Attributes. If false the search will only take place direct at the top level.

example.code:
' Example: Get the Attribute Values for the given ' Attribute using the SOP Class UID and System Name that ' are set.
Dim dqLibrary As DefinitionQueryLibrary Dim values As StringCollection Dim value As String
dqLibrary = new DefinitionQueryLibrary
' Set the SOP Class UID and System Name. dqLibrary.SetSOPClassUID("1.2.87.478.56.99.3.2.1") dqLibrary.SetSystemName("DICOM")
' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). values = dqLibrary.GetAttributeValues("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. For Each value in values Console.WriteLine("The Value for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + value) Next value
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). values = dqLibrary.GetAttributeValues("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. For Each value in values Console.WriteLine("The Value for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + value) Next value

member.returns: Returns a StringCollection containing the Values as String.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to get the Defined Values for in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format. See also the example code.

' Single Attribute and look also inside other Attributes (Recursive). definedValues = dqLibrary.GetAttributeDefinedValues("0x00101010", true)
' Show the result. For Each definedValue in definedValues Console.WriteLine("The Defined Value for Attribute 0x00101010 = " + definedValue) Next definedValue
' Attribute path but don't look inside other Attributes (Recursive). definedValues = dqLibrary.GetAttributeDefinedValues("0x00101010/0x20205555", false)
' Show the result. For Each definedValue in definedValues Console.WriteLine("The Defined Value for Attribute 0x20205555 = " + definedValue) Next definedValue

member.returns: Returns a StringCollection containing the Defined Values as String.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the query can't be executed succesfully.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.parseAttributeParam(System.String)
member.summary: Parses an Attribute or Attribute path string into a XPath Query string. See also the example code.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute path to parse in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format.
member.exception: Throws an Exception of the Parameter can't be parsed.
member.returns: A string containing the XPath Query.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.DefinitionQueryLibrary.GetAttributeTree(System.String)
member.summary: Recursive support function for the public GetAttributeTree() function. This function will return for each top level Attribute a list of Attributes it includes in full Attribute Path notation. See also the example code.
member.param: Attribute or Attribute Path to look in for included Attributes in the 0x12345678 or 0x10101010/0x20202020/0x30303030 format.
member.returns: A StringCollection containing the Attribute and Attributes included.

member.name: T:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager
member.summary: The FileManager manages the loading and unloading of definition files. It ensures that definition files are only loaded once. It provides access to definition files by using their full path name or by SOP Class UID.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.fileHashTable
member.summary: Holds the XPathDocument instances of the Xml Definition file with as key the full path and filename to the Xml Definition file.

member.name: F:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.mappingHashTable
member.summary:
Holds a mapping between the Xlm Definition filename that is used as key in the
fileHashTable and the combination of SOP Class UID and System Name. The mapping table is needed for selecting Xml Definition files by filename and a combination of SOP Class UID ans System Name. The key combination is created with the
createKey function.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructor for the
FileManager class.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.GetFile(System.String)
member.summary: Get the XPathDocument Instance for the Xml Definition file specified in the FileName.
member.param: Full path to the Xml Definition File. See also the example code.
member.returns: An XPathDocument instance of the Xml Definition file.
member.exception: If the Xml Definition file is not loaded an Exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.GetFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the XPathDocument Instance for the Xml Definition file with SOP Class UID SOPClassUID and with System Name SystemName.
member.param: Contains the SOP Class UID of the Xml Definition file. See also the example code.
Contains the System Name of the Xml Definition file. See also the example code.
member.returns: A XPathDocument instance of the Xml Definition file.
member.exception: If the Xml Definition file is not loaded an Exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.PreLoadFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a XPathDocument instance for the Xml Definition file. This can be used to preload definition files. If the file has already been loaded it will be ignored.
member.param: Full path to the XML File

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.GetLoadedFiles
member.summary: Provides a list of all the Xml Definition files that are currently loaded.
member.returns: An Array of strings containing the full path of all Xml Definition files.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.loadFile(System.String)
member.summary:
Create a XPathDocument instance of the Xml Definition file in FileName. Add the XPathDocument instance to the
fileHashTable . Query the Xml Definition file for the SOP Class UID and System Name and create a mapping key of it with the
createKey function. Add the createKey to the
mappingHashTable .
member.param: Full path to the Xml Definition File. See also the example code.

example.code: // Example: Load Xml Definition File. loadFile("C:\example.xml");

member.remarks: This function will filter out the <Macro> and </Macro> attributes from the Xml File.
member.exception: If the Xml Definition file is incorrect or doesn't contain a SOP Class UID or System Name an Exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.FileManager.createKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a key for the fileHashTable to identify Xml Definition files. The key will consist of the SOPClassUID and SystemName.
member.param: The UID of the SOP Class. See also the example code.
The System Name. See also the example code.
member.returns: A string forming the key to identify the Xml Definition file.
member.remarks: Always use this function to create keys for the fileHashTable to ensure correct keys trough out the entire application.

member.name: T:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.QueryManager
member.summary: Class manages the list of all pre-compiled XPath queries.
member.remarks: Only static queries are handled by this class. Dynamic query support may be added later using the library from the XMLMVP project. See http://www.mvpxml.org for the project website and the blog postings of Daniel Cazzulino at http://clariusconsulting.net/blogs/kzu/archive/2003/10/07/82.aspx.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.QueryManager.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructor for the
QueryManager class.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.QueryManager.GetQuery(System.String)
member.summary: Get the XPathExpression instance containing the pre-compiled query for the QueryKey.
member.param: A string identifying the query.
member.returns: A XPathExpression containing the pre-compiled query expression.
member.exception: Throws an Exception if the QueryKey can't be found.

member.name: M:Dvtk.Definition_Query_Library.QueryManager.initQueryTable
member.summary:
Fills the
queryHashTable with pre-compiled queries.

example.code: initQueryTable();
